{{also|Machen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|-}}, from {{inh|de|goh|mahhōn}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*makōną}}; akin to {{cog|nds|maken}}, {{cog|nl|maken}}, {{cog|en|make}}, {{cog|fy|meitsje}}. Ultimately from {{der|de|ine-pro|*mag-|t=to knead, mix, make}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈmaxən/|[ˈmaχ(ə)n]|[ˈmäxən̩]|[ˈmäxɛn]|[ˈmɑχən]}} * {{a|Germany}} {{audio|de|De-machen.ogg}} * {{a|Austria|Southern Germany}} {{audio|de|De-at-machen.ogg}} * {{rhymes|de|aχn}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|macht|machte|gemacht}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[make]], [[produce]], [[create]] (an object, arrangement, situation, etc.) #: {{ux|de|Ich '''hab''' dir einen Kuchen '''gemacht'''!|inline=1|I '''have made''' you a pie!}} #: {{ux|de|Du hast einen Fehler '''gemacht'''.|inline=1|You '''made''' a mistake.}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[take]] (a photo) # {{lb|de|transitive|of food, drinks, etc.}} to make, [[prepare]] #: {{ux|de|'''Machst''' du heute das Essen?|inline=1|'''Are''' you '''making''' dinner today?}} #: {{ux|de|sich eine Pizza '''machen'''|inline=1|to '''prepare''' a pizza for oneself}} # {{lb|de|transitive|informal}} to [[do]], [[perform]], [[carry out]] {{gloss|to execute; to put into operation (an action)}} #: {{ux|de|'''Mach''' es!|inline=1|'''Do''' it!}} #: {{ux|de|Das '''hat''' er ganz allein '''gemacht'''!|inline=1|He '''has done''' that all by himself!}} #: {{ux|de|ein Experiment '''machen'''|to '''perform''' an experiment|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|transitive|with a noun}} to [[do]]; {{n-g|indicates an activity associated with a noun}} #: {{ux|de|Sport '''machen'''|'''do''' sports|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|eine Party '''machen'''|'''have''' a party|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[go]] {{gloss|to make the (specified) sound}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[make]] {{gloss|to cause or compel (to do something)}} # {{lb|de|transitive|of difficulties, pain, etc.}} to [[cause]] {{gloss|to set off an event or action or produce as a result}} # {{lb|de|transitive|with an adjective}} to [[make]] {{gloss|to cause to be}} # {{lb|de|transitive|with a noun}} to [[make]] ({{m|de|aus}} (“into”)) {{gloss|to cause to become}} # {{lb|de|transitive|usually not translated literally}} to [[make]] {{gloss|to have as a feature}} # {{lb|de|transitive|informal|colloquial}} to [[come to]], [[total]], [[cost]] {{gloss|to require the payment of}} #: {{ux|de|Wie viel '''macht''' das?|inline=1|How much '''does''' that '''come to'''?}} # {{lb|de|transitive|arithmetic}} to [[make]], [[be]] {{gloss|to have a sum of}} # {{lb|de|transitive|informal|colloquial}} to [[make]] {{gloss|to earn, gain wages, profit, etc.}} #: {{ux|de|Der Herr Müller ist echt reich; der '''macht''' mehr als 5000 im Monat.|Mr Müller is quite rich; he '''makes''' more than 5000 bucks per month.}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[be]], [[play]] {{gloss|to act as the indicated role, especially in a performance}} # {{lb|de|transitive|of a bed}} to [[make]] {{gloss|to cover neatly with bedclothes}} # {{lb|de|transitive|impersonal|colloquial}} to [[matter]] {{gloss|to be important}} #: {{ux|de|Das '''macht''' nichts!|inline=1|That doesn't '''matter'''!}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|with ''[[auf]]''}} to [[make]], make oneself out to be, [[act]], [[play]] {{gloss|to behave so as to give an appearance of being; to act as if one were (something, or a certain way)}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|informal|euphemistic}} to [[do one's business]], do [[number two]] or [[number one]], [[go]] {{gloss|to defecate or urinate}} #: {{ux|de|{{q|childish}} groß '''machen'''|'''to go''' poop|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|{{q|childish}} klein '''machen'''|'''to go''' pee|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[do]] {{gloss|to fare or perform (well or poorly)}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[look]] {{gloss|to have an appearance of being}} #: {{ux|de|Der Mantel '''macht sich''' sehr schön.|The coat '''looks''' very nice.|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|reflexive|_|dative|colloquial}} to [[get cracking]] ({{m|de|an}} (“on,” “with”)), [[get a move on]] (it), to [[get down]] ({{m|de|an}} (“to”)) (something); {{q|in imperative:}} [[come on]], [[let's go]] ====Usage notes==== Unlike English, the verb {{m|de|machen|t=[[make]]}} is used as a synonym for {{m|de|tun|t=[[do]]}} in most cases. However, ''tun'' cannot be used for the proper senses of ''machen''. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|mach|gemacht|h}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|to make, to produce}} {{l|de|produzieren}}, {{l|de|herstellen}} * {{sense|to do}} {{l|de|tun}} * {{sense|to prepare food, drinks}} {{l|de|vorbereiten}} * {{sense|to matter}} {{l|de|eine Rolle spielen}}, {{l|de|wichtig sein}} * {{sense|to come to, to total, to cost}} {{l|de|kosten}} * {{sense|to earn}} {{l|de|verdienen}}, {{l|de|einheimsen}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de|abmachen|anmachen|aufmachen|ausmachen|bekanntmachen|draufmachen|durchmachen|einmachen|fertigmachen|sich [[fortmachen]]|heilmachen|hermachen|heruntermachen|hinmachen|kaputtmachen|kleinmachen|miesmachen|nachmachen|niedermachen|reinemachen|saubermachen|Sinn machen|Übung macht den Meister|vermachen|vormachen|wegmachen|wiedergutmachen|zumachen}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Spanish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|es|/ˈmatʃen/|[ˈmätʃe̞n]}} ===Verb=== {{head|es|verb form}} # {{es-verb form of|ending=ar|mood=imperative|pers=2|formal=yes|number=plural|machar}} # {{es-verb form of|ending=ar|mood=subjunctive|tense=present|pers=2|formal=yes|number=plural|machar}} # {{es-verb form of|ending=ar|mood=subjunctive|tense=present|pers=3|number=plural|machar}}
